Row.Text: Strudeler's Civilization VI Deluxe
01. Introduction and Changelog
This mod has been a hobby since modding tools were released. The aim: make game bigger; make era longer; make building easier; make progress slower; make combat into meat grinder.

[COLOR:Red]VERSION 1.0.1[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]-Welcome (again) to the re:launch! [NEWLINE]-Added more text to the mod's civilopedia pages; the concepts page explicitly descibes changes made and new features (such as statistics for pantheons, policieis, etc.). [NEWLINE]-Vikingr Lodges was broken, changed to: +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith in [ICON_Buildings] Barracks, Stables, Lighthouse, Hangar. [NEWLINE]-Fixed an issue with text for Unit Abilities. [NEWLINE]-Venetian Arsenal does not duplicate Naval Melee or Aircraft Carrier class Units. [NEWLINE]-Wonders have various bonus intrinsic yields.

[COLOR:Red]VERSION 1.0.2[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]-Some Text fixes. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Jund Rider's [ICON_Promotion] Righteous Conversion Promotion increased to +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Religion] Religious enemies and removed the +1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Jund Rider's [ICON_Promotion] Jihad Sultans Promotion removed the -3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength penalty for adjacent enemy [ICON_Unit] Units. Other ability remains. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] Father Governs Children increased to +5% [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture per City-State Suzerainty. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] Sapper Tactics Policy grants [ICON_Unit] Siege Units +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength per adjacent [ICON_Unit] Unit. City [ICON_Gold] Gold Maintenance unchanged. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] Unrelenting People Policy grants +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units with higher [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. [ICON_Unit] Unit [ICON_Gold] Gold Maintenance penalty reduced to -1. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] Diadochi Wars and Interventionism have been temporarily removed due to a bug where [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength would stack arbitrarily, bonuses ranging from 90-300+ (thank you to [COLOR:Blue]ekids789788[ENDCOLOR] for spotting the issue). [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] Fixed [ICON_Resource_Iron] Resource costs for [ICON_Unit] Aircraft Carrier and Nuclear Submarine.

[COLOR:Red]VERSION 1.0.3[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]-Cities gain +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strengh per [ICON_Citizen] Population. [NEWLINE]-All [ICON_Unit] Military Units unlocked by [ICON_Religion] Religious Belief require the [ICON_Culture] Theology Civic. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Naturalist: Increased to 1400 [ICON_Faith] Faith cost; increasing by 1400 [ICON_Faith] Faith at the end of the Tech/Civic tree. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Line Infantry/Rifleman: Renamed to Rifleman and is unlocked at Rifling; Redcoat and Garde Imperiale do not require Rifling. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Bireme: +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Hetairoi: +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when on a [ICON_Terrain] Continent different than the [ICON_Capital] Capital's. (Note: Previous bonus from [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great Generals was bugged and this serves as a replacement). [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Dromon: Reverted to +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated De Seven Provincien: Maintenance reduced to 1. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Updated Military Engineer: Support Unit that can attack and defend. 30 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 40 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Range. (Prisoner of War does have [ICON_Strength] Strength). [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] Mountie: Modern Era Ranged Cavalry Unit. Replaces the Military Police. 6 Maintenance. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Range; doubled if in or adjacent to home territory. +17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Ranged] Range if occupying a [ICON_District] District. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Military Police Unit: Modern Era Ranged Cavalry Unit. 58 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 7 Maintenance. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged; doubled if on or adjacent to home territory. +17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Ranged] Range when occupying a [ICON_District] District. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Heavy Rider Unit: Classical Era Heavy Cavalry Unit. 34 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 4 Maintenance. Upgrades from [ICON_Unit] Heavy Chariot. Upgrades into [ICON_Unit] Knight. Is replaced by the [ICON_Unit] Varu and Hetairoi. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Trireme Unit: Classical Era Naval Melee Unit. 22 [ICON_Strength] Strength. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when on [ICON_Terrain] Coast. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength per unused [ICON_Movement] Movement. 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 3 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Carrack Unit: Renaissance Era Naval Melee Unit. 43 [ICON_Strength] Strength. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when on [ICON_Terrain] Coast. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength per unused [ICON_Movement] Movement. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 5 Maintenance. Upgrades from Trireme. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Surface Ship Unit: Modern Era Naval Melee Unit. 74 [ICON_Strength] Strength. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when on [ICON_Terrain] Coast. +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength per unused [ICON_Movement] Movement. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 9 Maintenance. Upgrades from Galleon. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Barrage Ship Unit: Ancient Era Naval Ranged Unit. 21 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. +14 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 3 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Galleon Unit: Medieval Era Naval Ranged Unit. 41 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 44 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. +14 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 6 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Corvette Unit: Modern Era Naval Ranged Unit. 64 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 72 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. +14 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 9 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Artillery Ship Unit: Classical Era Naval Ranged Unit. 27 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 18 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 2 [ICON_Ranged] Range. +17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against City Defenses. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 3 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Warship Unit: Renaissance Era Naval Ranged Unit. 55 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 43 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 3 [ICON_Ranged] Range. +17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against City Defenses. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 8 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Capital Ship Unit: Modern Era Naval Ranged Unit. 100 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 73 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 4 [ICON_Ranged] Range. +17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against City Defenses. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 20 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Recon Ship: Ancient Era Naval Raider Unit. 20 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and 15 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 3 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Corsair Unit: Medieval Era Naval Raider Unit. 32 [ICON_Strength] Strength and 40 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Zealot Unit: Religious Military Ranged Unit. Unlocked with the [ICON_Religion] Fierce Identity Belief. Has a unique [ICON_Promotion] Promotion tree. 34 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 2 Maintenance. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Religion] Religious enemies. Can move after attacking. Gain [ICON_Strength] Strength from certain [ICON_Culture] Civics. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] New Fierce Identity Belief: Unlocks the Zealot Unit. +3 [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Faith] Faith per level of [ICON_Buildings] Walls. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New White Elephant Unit: Religious Military Ranged Cavalry Unit. Unlocked with the [ICON_Religion] Murti Belief. Has a unique [ICON_Promotion] Promotion tree. 34 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 12 Maintenance. 1 [ICON_Ranged] Range. Gain [ICON_Strength] Strength from certain [ICON_Culture] Civics. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] New Murti Belief: Unlocks the White Elephant Unit. +4 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, and [ICON_Faith] Faith in [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Buildings] New Angevin Port Building: Unique to Eleanor of Aquitaine. Replaces the Shipyard. Identical to Shipyard. +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture. 3 [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work of Art Slots, automatically themed by Eleanor's trait. [NEWLINE]-Rework Eleanor of Aquitaine: No longer automatically themes [ICON_Buildings] Art Museums or Archaeological Museums; automatically themes [ICON_Buildings] Angevin Port. +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist poin in [ICON_DISTRICT_HARBOR] Harbor. [NEWLINE]-Rework Basil II: +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold on [ICON_Charges] Farms. [ICON_Unit] Light Cavalry and Heavy Cavalry deal full damage to [ICON_Buildings] Walls if the City follows the player's dominate [ICON_Religion] Religion. Gain the [ICON_Unit] Tagma unique Unit at the [ICON_Culture] Divine Right Civic. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Buildings] New Theodosian Walls: Unique to Byzantium. Must be built in the [ICON_Capital] Capital. +50 HP and +7 [ICON_Strength] City Strength. +3 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Gold] Gold, [ICON_Faith] Faith, as well as +5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. [NEWLINE]-Rework Byzantium: +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point in [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site. Cities within 6 tiles of the [ICON_Capital] Capital gain +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold and +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith; Cities more than 7 tiles away from the [ICON_Capital] Capital lose -25% [ICON_Gold] Gold and -50% [ICON_Faith] Faith.[ICON_Unit] Military Units and [ICON_Religion] Religious Units gain +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength per [ICON_Religion] Holy City converted to the player's [ICON_Religion] Religion. [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Units spread the player's [ICON_Religion] Religion when killing a enemy. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Rework Vulcan Pantheon: +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Advantage against [ICON_Barbarian] Barbarians. [ICON_Charges] Mines can be built on all [ICON_Terrain] Land tiles. [ICON_Charges] Mines do not have a [ICON_Food] Food penalty on their tile. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Rework Nun Pantheon: Reduced to +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards the [ICON_DISTRICT_PRESERVE] Preserve and its [ICON_Buildings] Buildings. Removed +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on Breathtaking Appeal tiles; added +1 Appeal on all tiles in a City. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Follower Beliefs: Most follower beliefs have had minor yield increases. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Rework Bushido Belief: +20% [ICON_Ability] Experience. Accumulated War Weariness reduction reduced to 20%. In addition to regular abilities. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Bug Fix Obsidian Obelisks: Monuments now get +1 [ICON_Production] Production properly as base. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Religion] Rework Burial Tombs Belief: +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold in [ICON_Buildings] Monument, Granary, Ancient Walls, Medieval Walls, and Reneaissance Walls. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Combat Engineers Policy (Military): [ICON_Unit] Military Engineers gain +25 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_District] Districts. +30% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_Unit] Military Engineers. City Maintenance increases by 2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Artillery Command Policy (Military): [ICON_Unit] Siege class Units gain +1 [ICON_Ranged] Range when occupying a [ICON_District] District; +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in or adjacent to friendly territory and doubled against [ICON_Unit] Naval Units. City Maintenance increases by 3 [ICON_Gold] Gold. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New War Measures Act Policy (Diplomatic): Cities gain +50% [ICON_Production] Production for the first 5 turns after being declared war upon or liberating a City. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Religious Pluralism Policy (Wildcard): +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per [ICON_Religion] Religion present in a City. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Fracking Policy (Economics): Can build [ICON_Charges] Mines on all [ICON_Terrain] Land tiles. +1 [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Gold] Gold on [ICON_Charges] Mines. Makes [ICON_Policy] Mining Guilds obsolete. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Education Initiative Policy (Wildcard): +15% [ICON_Science] Science in all Cities while at peace with major players. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Avante Garde Policy (Wildcard): +15% [ICON_Culture] Culture in all Cities while at peace with major players. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Splendid Isolation Policy (Wildcard): +15% [ICON_Production] Production in all Cities while at peace with major players. [NEWLINE]-Buffed City-States: City-States ignore Loyalty penalties. City-States gain +5 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. City-States gain +0.4 [ICON_Food] Food, +0.8 [ICON_Production] Production, as well as +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per [ICON_Citizen] Population.

[COLOR:Red]VERSION 1.0.4 (PREVIEW)[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Bard Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Tourism] Tourism on certain tiles. Upgrades into the [ICON_Unit] Rockband. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Presbyter Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. Cannot attack. 1 Charge. 70 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 5 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 1 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Scholar Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. 2 Charges. 110 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. Gain 3 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist and [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points when defeating another [ICON_Unit] Unit. Must be purchased in Cities with a [ICON_Buildings] Temple or Library. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Poet Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. 2 Charges. 110 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. Gain 2 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer and [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points when defeating another [ICON_Unit] Unit. Must be in Cities with a [ICON_Buildings] Temple or Amphitheater. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Witch Doctor Unit: Religious Unit that heals adjacent [ICON_Unit] Military Units 10 [ICON_Health] Health when [ICON_Fortified] Fortified and can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. Cannot attack. 2 Charges. 85 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Mufti Unit: Religious Unit that removes [ICON_Religion] Heresy. 2 Charges. 100 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. +25 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength when attacking. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Shaman Unit: Religious Unit that grants adjacent [ICON_Unit] Religious Units +10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength and can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. Cannot attack. 1 Charge. 80 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Priestess Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. Cannot attack. 6 Charges. 125 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Mobad Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. Cannot attack. 3 Charges. 100 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. Gain 35 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Gold] Gold, and [ICON_Faith] Faith when converting a City for the first time. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Disciple Unit: Religious Unit that produces a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic when killed in [ICON_Religion] Religious Combat and can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion. 3 Charges. 110 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Unit] New Librarian Unit: Religious Unit that can spread [ICON_Religion] Religion and must be purchased in a City with a [ICON_Buildings] Wenmiao. 5 Charges. 120 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. 2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight. 10 Maintenance. Gain 50 [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture when converting a City for the first time. Gain 4 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist and [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer points when defeating another [ICON_Unit] Unit. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Buildings] New Wenmiao Building: Religious Building unlocked with the [ICON_Religion] Wenmiao Belief. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +3 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist and [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer point per turn. 2 [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Work of Writing slots. [NEWLINE]-[ICON_Policy] New Holy Library Policy: Renaissance Era [ICON_Policy] Policy. +3 [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Faith] Faith in the [ICON_Buildings] Wenmiao.

02. Game Mechanics

[COLOR:Red]GOODY HUTS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tribal Villages (or Goody Huts) appear every 50 tiles and can spawn up to 4 tiles apart. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Science Goody Huts: 30% Chance to get 20 [ICON_Science] Culture (Requires Turn 0); 40% Chance to get 40 [ICON_Science] Science (Requires Turn 40); 30% Chance to get 1 [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cultural Goody Huts: 30% Chance to get 20 [ICON_Culture] Culture (Requires Turn 0); 40% Chance to get 40 [ICON_Culture] Culture (Requires Turn 40); 30% Chance to get 1 [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gold Goody Huts: 30% Chance to get 150 [ICON_Gold] Gold (Requires Turn 0); 30% Chance to get 300 [ICON_Gold] Gold (Requires Turn 20); 40% Chance to get 600 Gold (Requires to 40). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Faith Goody Huts: 20% Chance to get 500 [ICON_Faith] Faith (Requires Turn 0, Capital Founded); 10% Chance to get an early [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic (Requires Turn 100, Capital Founded); 70% Chance to get a late [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic (Requires Turn 250, Capital Founded). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civilian Goody Huts: 40% Chance to get 1 [ICON_Citizen] Population (Requires Turn 5, Capital Founded); 40% Chance to get 1 [ICON_Unit] Builder (Requires Turn 5, Capital Founded); 20% Chance to get 1 [ICON_Unit] Population (Requires Turn 25, Capital Founded). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Meteor Goody Huts: Even chance to get 150 [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR:Red]GAME MECHANICS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pillage Rewards: Cut the yield rewards from pillaging [ICON_Charges] Improvements and [ICON_District] Districts in half; healing from pillaging reduced to 30. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Base Movement: Increased by +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for most [ICON_Unit] Units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Base Maintenance: Increases Maintenance by +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for most [ICON_Unit] Units and [ICON_Buildings] Buildings; [ICON_District] Districts except for the [ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Seowon and [ICON_DISTRICT_SPACEPORT] Space Port have 0 [ICON_Gold] Gold Maintenance. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Resource Requirements and Maintenance: Most [ICON_Unit] Military Units after the [ICON_Science] Classical Era require Resource Maintenance. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cost to Pillage: Costs 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cost to Embark: Costs 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Movement While Embarked: Base 3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trading Posts in Owned City: [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trading Posts in Foreign City: [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Religion: Spreads to Cities 6 tiles away; pressure increased to 2; "atheism" pressure lowered to 20; Holy City pressure multiplier increased to 6; religious spread strength increased to 600; [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes send 6 pressure. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City Defenses: Cities do not gain [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from [ICON_Citizen] Population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spawn Distances: City-States can spawn within 5 tiles of another City-State; City-States can spawn within 6 tiles of a Major Civ; Major Civs spawn at least 20 tiles away (unless the map can't handle it); City-States and Major Civs can spawn up to 1 tile away from Natural Wonders. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR:Red]TILES[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ice: Rate of ice spawning on water tiles lowered to 10%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grassland: 3 [ICON_Food] Food. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grassland Hills: 1 [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Production] Production, and [ICON_Gold] Gold. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Plains: 1 [ICON_Production] Prodcution and 2 [ICON_Food] Food. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Plains Hills: 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 2 [ICON_Production] Production. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Desert: 1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Desert Hills: 1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and 2 [ICON_Production] Production. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Coast/Lake: 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 2 [ICON_Food] Food. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ocean: 1 [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Culture] Culture. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tundra: 1 [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production. 22. Technologies and Civics

[COLOR:Red]TECHNOLOGY AND CIVIC COSTS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]Researching a Tech or Civic from the next era has a 50% penalty. [NEWLINE]Researching a Tech or Civic from the previous era has no catchup bonus. [NEWLINE]Ancient Era costs x0.8 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Classical Era costs x1.2 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Medieval Era costs x2.8 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Renaissance Era costs x2.8 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Industrial Era costs x2.8 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Modern Era costs x2.6 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Atomic Era cost x2.3 the usual cost. [NEWLINE]Information Era cost x2.3 the usual costs. [NEWLINE]Future Era costs x5 the usual cost (only effects Future Tech and Future Civic). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR:Red]RANDOM TECH AND CIVIC COSTS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]Random Technology and Civics (i.e. Future or Shuffle Mode) cost x2.5 the usual cost. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR:Red]EUREKA AND INSPIRATION BOOSTS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]Eurekas and Inspirations grant 30% of Tech or Civic cost. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR:Red]ERAS[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]Age Thresholds increase by +2 Era Score per City the player owns. [NEWLINE]Ancient Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Classical Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Medieval Era: Lasts 74-82 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Renaissance Era: Lasts 64-72 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Industrial Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Atomic Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Modern Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard). [NEWLINE]Information Era: Lasts 54-62 turns (on standard).

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tier 1 Governments: [ICON_Government] Oligarchy, Autocracy, and Classical Republic gain bonus +0.3 [ICON_Production] Production and +4 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron; in addition to usual bonuses. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tier 2 Governments: [ICON_Government] Monarchy gains bonus +0.5 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Government] Theocracy and Merchant Republic gain +0.4 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Government] Monarchy, Theocracy, and Merchant Republic gain +6 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron and +4 [ICON_Resource_Horses] Horses; in addition to usual bonuses. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tier 3 Governments: [ICON_Government] Democracy gains bonus +0.2 [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture, as well as +0.5 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Government] Fascism gains +0.3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +0.6 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Government] Communism gains +0.3 [ICON_Science] Science and +0.6 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Government] Democracy, Fascism, and Communism gain +16 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron, +8 [ICON_Resource_Niter] Niter, +6 [ICON_Resource_Horses] Horses and [ICON_Resource_Coal] Coal, +4 [ICON_Resource_Oil] Oil and Aluminum; in addition to usual bonuses. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Tier 4 Governments: [ICON_Government] Digital Democracy, Corporate Libertarianism, and Synthetic Technocracy gain +0.8 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen and +18 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron, +10 [ICON_Resource_Niter] Niter, +8 [ICON_Resource_Horses] Horses and [ICON_Resource_Coal] Coal and [ICON_Resource_Oil] Oil and Aluminum; in addition to usual bonuses.
